server back in that is you know separate from the core release process and that's been a more recent area of investment

was that we had IP addresses with leading zeros so if you say like
18260 one4 like is that octal for is a decimal 14 or is it like a 12 in octal
right and turns out all the BSD IP address parsers treat that as and and it's like wow okay I didn't know
that when I wrote the IP address parser and go and we treat them as decimal and so if different tools are reading them they they actually disagree on what it
means and so we changed it to just disallow leading zeros so you know we can't change what we used to return but
we can say we're not going to parse that anymore and now at least if we accept an IP address it won't mean something
different to someone else but the kubernetes team was rightly worried that there might be configs out there that
have written leading zeros and tending decimal because that's what go gets you and that you know it'll break people and
so that's an example of the sort of change we used to make where you know it kept them from updating and so we did a
